summary: This bill, S.603, proposes to designate the General George C. Marshall House in Virginia as an affiliated area of the National Park System. The bill aims to promote public appreciation of George C. Marshall's contributions. It outlines the area's description, management, and the roles of the Secretary of the Interior and the George C. Marshall International Center. The Secretary is authorized to provide technical and financial assistance but cannot acquire property or assume financial responsibility for the area's operation.
